components module

components.create_battleships(filename: str = 'battleships.txt') → dict[str, int][source]

Loads ship lengths from a config file

Parameters:

filename (str, optional) – Name of config file, defaults to “battleships.txt”

Raises:

ValueError – If any line fails to match the string:int format

Returns:

Dictionary with the key as the ship name and the value as the ship length

Return type:

dict[str, int]

components.dict_from_json_file(filename: str) → dict[source]

Returns a dict from the contents of a JSON file

Parameters:

filename (str) – Name of JSON file

Returns:

Dictionary derived from parsed JSON

Return type:

dict

components.initialise_board(size: int = 10) → list[list[str | None]][source]

Returns a square board initialised with None

Parameters:

size (int, optional) – Width of the board, defaults to 10

Returns:

2D list of length size in both dimensions

Return type:

list[list[None]]

components.place_battleships(board: list[list[str | None]], ships: dict[str, int], algorithm: str = 'simple', placement: dict[str, list[str]] = {}) → list[list[str | None]][source]

Modifies board in-place, replacing None with the name of each ship

Parameters:

  • board (Board) – Board to modify

  • ships (dict[str, int]) – Dictionary of all ship types and its length, does not contain any coordinates or rotation data

  • algorithm (str, optional) – Type of placement algorithm to use, defaults to “simple”

  • placement (dict[str, list[str]], optional) – Dictionary of ship coordinates and corresponding rotations, only used for algorithms that benefit from user-specified configurations, such as custom_placement_algorithm, defaults to dict_from_json_file(“placement.json”)

Raises:

ValueError – If the algorithm argument does not match any algorithms defined in the match statement

Returns:

A reference to the same instance as the original board passed in the board argument

Return type:

Board
